story:
Defeating diarrhea with cricket bats.

India’s Sanitation Crisis

626 million Indians live without access to a toilet and go outside to relieve themselves: come rain, shine, darkness, illness, or decapitation. Beyond the immeasurable cost in terms of human dignity, lack of sanitation spreads diseases like diarrhea that kill 1,000 Indian children a day, and causes over $53 billion in economic loss due to lost productivity and medical expenses. 

The picture is grim .... and given the magnitude of the problem, solving India’s sanitation crisis has not been easy. India is still last in the World Diarrhea Rankings; way behind other countries such as Pakistan and Bangladesh.

The Power Of Cricket

Our biggest problems can be conquered only by our biggest passions and in India, few things hold as much promise and power as does cricket. Cricket is called the Beautiful Game and captures the imagination and emotions of more than a billion people in India shaping their ideals and dreams.

Sapna Kumari and the national finalists of the NBY's WASH Star sanitation-themed singing contest raise their respective awards at the grand finale in Bettiah, Bihar.

What Is Potty Cricket

Potty Cricket is a social enterprise that will sell professional quality cricket gear to cricket lovers across the world at regular retail prices, as a way to raise money for innovative sanitation development efforts. We will also have Special Edition gear on sale, autographed by leading Indian cricketers -- a once in a lifetime opportunity to get your hands on rare, signed equipment.

When you buy gear from Potty Cricket, about 40% of the price, which otherwise would have been the profit margin for sporting goods retailers, will go to support proven high-impact sanitation and hygiene programs.

All of our gear will be sourced directly, at deeply discounted prices, from leading manufacturers of professional quality cricket equipment in India. Professional cricket players will serve as consultants and ensure that we procure only the highest quality products.  

Disclaimer: Actual Potty Cricket gear will look different (better) than the above samples.


Potty Cricket Bats

Two things go into making a great cricket bat.

  • The Design Specs: Grade of Willow, the positioning of the sweet spot, the weight, the handle, edge thickness, the shape of bow.  
  • Manufacturing + Craftsmanship:  The quality of wood and clefts that are sourced, the drying process, the bat making process.


To start out with, we’re offering 3 cricket bat designs

  • Royal Flush: Made from premium Grade 1 English Willow. USD 325 + shipping
  • Clean Sweep: Made from Grade 1 English Willow: USD 225 + shipping
  • Wise Crack: Made from Grade 2-3 English Willow: USD 125 + shipping


All Potty Cricket bats will have the following features:

  • Handcrafted by master bat makers in India
  • Perfectly balanced & light pick up
  • A larger sweet spot for extra power
  • Thick edges
  • Natural, unbleached, super smooth wax finished
  • Chevrec Grips
  • Toe Guards
  • Full length case


When you buy any of these bats, you can specify the following

  • Weight: Light Weight - 2lb 8oz to 2lb 9oz / Medium Weight - 2lb 10oz to 2lb 12oz / Heavy Weight - 2lb 13oz to 2lb 14oz
  • Handle: Long Handle / Short Handle
  • Knocking: Yes (USD 50 extra) / No
  • Scuff Sheet: None / Clear / Mesh
  • Stickers: None / Selection from 3 stickers made by leading Indian artists / Potty Cricket logo


Supporting The Nirmal Bharat Yatra Shortfall

Our Fundraising Goal

As our launch project, we are raising USD 120,000 for the Nirmal Bharat Yatra -- a massive campaign on sanitation and hygiene that took the form of a village carnival and travelled 2,000kms across rural India from Wardha, Maharashtra to Bettiah, Bihar over 50 days this past autumn. The spread the word on the importance of using toilets, washing hands with soap, and breaking the taboo of speaking about menstrual hygiene by using interactive cricket-based games and captivating stage performances, as well as targeted workshops. The Yatra was organized by WASH United ,an international non-profit, and Quicksand Design Studio, an Indian design firm. You can find more information on their ambitious future plans here.

The Nirmal Bharat Yatra as seen from a nearby water tower in Sewagram, Maharashtra.

Children line up to play the NBY's cricket-based sanitation-themed games in Gorakhpur. 

The Yatra was a massive logistical exercise that involved a crew of 470, 40 trucks, 10 buses traveling across Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan, Uttar Pradesh, & Bihar - the states most badly afflicted by poor sanitation coverage in India.

WASH United raised USD 2.3 million for the Nirmal Bharat Yatra from donors that included the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Swiss Agency For Development & Cooperation, GIZ, WSSCC, Arghyam & several others.


Ina Jurga, director of the NBY's WASH in Schools program, gives Minister of Rural Development Jairam Ramesh the three-fingered WASH salute on the main stage.

However, this was the first anything like this was being done in India.  Unplanned costs have shot up and WASH United has exceeded budgets by about USD 120,000 or 5% of the total budget of USD 2.4 million. They need to pay vendors urgently and Potty Cricket is raising money to cover this shortfall.  

Thus, we are raising USD 120,000 urgently to pay off the shortfall on the Nirmal Bharat Yatra. Given that we will make about 40% on each bat sale, we need to sell about USD 300,000 worth of cricket bats. That's around 1,500 cricket bats.

Yatra Media Coverage: http://www.pottycricket.org/nirmal-bharat-yatra/media-coverage/ 

Team: http://www.pottycricket.org/home/the-team/ 

Contact Us: info@pottycricket.org

FAQs

What cricket gear does Potty Cricket have ?
Potty Cricket has club & professional quality English Willow bats. We have three models:

  • Wise Crack (in the same category as Kookaburra Kahuna 900 )
  • Clean Sweep (in the same category as SG Sunny Gold
  • Royal Flush (in the same category as SG King Cobra )

Very soon we will be adding cricket balls & cricket apparel.

How can I specify details of the bat I want ?  
When you buy any of these bats, you can specify the following

  • Weight: Light - 2lb 8oz to 2lb 9oz / Medium - 2lb 10oz to 2lb 12oz / Heavy - 2lb 13oz to 2lb 14oz
  • Handle: Long / Short
  • Knocking: Yes (USD 50 extra) / No
  • Scuff Sheet: None / Clear / Mesh
  • Stickers: None / Choose from stickers made by leading Indian artists / Potty Cricket logo

To do this, after you choose your bat on Indiegogo and pay, we will send you a mail with a form in which you can specify these details.

Where will you get these bats from ?
We will source our bats directly from leading manufacturers in India who will craft these bats to our specs.

How is pricing determined ?
Potty Cricket charges regular retail prices for its regular cricket bats and a little extra for the special edition bats that are signed by our cricketing ambassadors.

How Will We Ensure That Potty Cricket Procures Really Good Bats?
Potty Cricket will adopt a three-step process to ensure that we procure the highest quality bats.

  • Global Research Survey: We will have in-depth conversations with at least 15 international + domestic cricketers, 2-3 bat manufacturers, and 20 club cricket players across the world to understand cricket bat preferences.
  • Cricket Consultants: We will hire a consultant with whom, first, we will identify the best manufacturers in India and second, do quality checks on ALL the bats that manufacturers supply based on our specs.
  • Transparent Updates: All of our conversations, survey results, field tests, visits to manufacturers will be documented and shared on our public blog so that our supporters understand

How does this raise money for sanitation and hygiene ?
Cricket bats have a 3 step supply chain. Manufacturers > Distributors > Retailers. In some cases, manufacturers sell bats directly to large retailers (such as global brands who apply their stickers / branding on the same bats).

Typically, manufacturers sell these bats to distributors at 60% of the retail price. This is the same price we get. When you buy a Potty Cricket bat, the other 40% (excluding shipping costs), is the “profit”, ALL of which is given to sanitation projects we support.



When will bats be delivered ?
Expected delivery for the bats is February - March 2013. Just in time for spring and the cricket season. If you have bat related inquiries, email us at order@pottycricket.org.
story_txt:
Defeating diarrhea with cricket bats.India’s Sanitation Crisis626 million Indians live without access to a toilet and go outside to relieve themselves: come rain, shine, darkness, illness, or decapitation. Beyond the immeasurable cost in terms of human dignity, lack of sanitation spreads diseases like diarrhea that kill 1,000 Indian children a day, and causes over $53 billion in economic loss due to lost productivity and medical expenses.  The picture is grim .... and given the magnitude of the problem, solving India’s sanitation crisis has not been easy. India is still last in the World Diarrhea Rankings; way behind other countries such as Pakistan and Bangladesh.The Power Of CricketOur biggest problems can be conquered only by our biggest passions and in India, few things hold as much promise and power as does cricket. Cricket is called the Beautiful Game and captures the imagination and emotions of more than a billion people in India shaping their ideals and dreams. 

Sapna Kumari and the national finalists of the NBY's WASH Star sanitation-themed singing contest raise their respective awards at the grand finale in Bettiah, Bihar.
What Is Potty CricketPotty Cricket is a social enterprise that will sell professional quality cricket gear to cricket lovers across the world at regular retail prices, as a way to raise money for innovative sanitation development efforts. We will also have Special Edition gear on sale, autographed by leading Indian cricketers -- a once in a lifetime opportunity to get your hands on rare, signed equipment. When you buy gear from Potty Cricket, about 40% of the price, which otherwise would have been the profit margin for sporting goods retailers, will go to support proven high-impact sanitation and hygiene programs. All of our gear will be sourced directly, at deeply discounted prices, from leading manufacturers of professional quality cricket equipment in India. Professional cricket players will serve as consultants and ensure that we procure only the highest quality products.  

Disclaimer: Actual Potty Cricket gear will look different (better) than the above samples.
Potty Cricket BatsTwo things go into making a great cricket bat.

The Design Specs: Grade of Willow, the positioning of the sweet spot, the weight, the handle, edge thickness, the shape of bow.  
Manufacturing + Craftsmanship:  The quality of wood and clefts that are sourced, the drying process, the bat making process.
To start out with, we’re offering 3 cricket bat designs

Royal Flush: Made from premium Grade 1 English Willow. USD 325 + shipping
Clean Sweep: Made from Grade 1 English Willow: USD 225 + shipping
Wise Crack: Made from Grade 2-3 English Willow: USD 125 + shipping
All Potty Cricket bats will have the following features:

Handcrafted by master bat makers in India
Perfectly balanced & light pick up
A larger sweet spot for extra power
Thick edges
Natural, unbleached, super smooth wax finished
Chevrec Grips
Toe Guards
Full length case
When you buy any of these bats, you can specify the following

Weight: Light Weight - 2lb 8oz to 2lb 9oz / Medium Weight - 2lb 10oz to 2lb 12oz / Heavy Weight - 2lb 13oz to 2lb 14oz
Handle: Long Handle / Short Handle
Knocking: Yes (USD 50 extra) / No
Scuff Sheet: None / Clear / Mesh
Stickers: None / Selection from 3 stickers made by leading Indian artists / Potty Cricket logo

story:
Rogues Gallery Presents

           Emerging Designers Fall/Winter 2013 Collections

    The Hotel Pennsylvania 401 7th Ave. New York, NY 10001

                             Sunday February 10, 2013

 

    RGP has been producing high quality fashion shows for a long time.  Our Emerging Designers runway event has been a labor of love for the past seven years.  It now attracts more than one thousand persons to the live show.  This year the show will be preceeded by a reception and gallery display by presenting designers, as well as an exhibition sale by accessory designers and corporate sponsors in the adjacent hall.

     This group show will include an amazing group of quality designers whose work deserves the opportunity to be showcased to buyers and press during New York Fashion Week.  The designers whose collections are selected for the RGP group show, are mostly independant businesses who create and sell limited edition lines to stores, have garnered some press and wish to expand their lines into more retail outlets.  RGP makes a runway show in the fashion capital of the world, both accessible and affordable.  When these small businesses grow, industry related jobs are a natural outgrowth.

     This show is an invitational fashion industry event, with limited ticket availability to non-industry persons.

 

   Budget

Your donations will go towards providing designers with:

  • A prestigious venue on 7th Avenue complete with runway and backdrop.
  • 40 Industry standard professional models.
  • Make up team.
  • Hair team.
  • Marketing
  • Personal media package
  • Large dressing area with assistants

      

 Who we are:

Ron Cooke: Artistic Director/Producer, Internationally recognized stylist and show coordinator who has produced shows for New York Fashion Week, Virginia Fashion Week, The Congressional Black Caucus and more.  Ron is an established stylist whose credits include magazines such as Heart and Soul, Arise, Today's Black Woman, celebrities such as Alicia Keyes, Lela Rachon and Danny Glover and other world renowned professionals including photographers, musicians, designers and atheletes.


Other Team Members:

Cookie Dabney: Assistant Director/Producer 

Patricia Peerzada: Executive Producer

Najila Harris: Event Coordinator

Macintosh Smith: Sponsorship and Marketing Representative

Willie Hall: Designer Consultant

Kalon Jackson: Creative Consultant

Forest Cooke: Technical Director

Carla Graham: Beauty Director

 

For tickets, corporate sponsors and other information please visit our website:

www.roguesgallerypresents.com

story:
Q.DESIGNS BACKGROUND

Hello, my name is Quintin Williams and I am the Founder/Designer of Q.DESIGNS. Q.DESIGNS Footwear is something I've been working to get off of the ground for some years now, and finally I've gotten to the point where I can possibly make it a reality!  I'm simply a 24 year-old, ambitious designer with tons of passion for putting cool footwear designs on people's feet.  I've designed for many brands including the Disney Company, Spira, Native Shoes, and PEAK Sports USA to name a few.  I've been lucky enough to be hand-selected for a 3-week PENSOLE course in Portland, OR, win a nation-wide shoe design contest, and live in China for 2 months designing an athletic boot line.  But to be able to showcase my passion through my own product is nothing less than priceless.  With your help, I can let you enjoy my creations just as much!    

                                                                Q.DESIGNS FAN PAGE


THE CONCEPT

Q.DESIGNS was designed to be a brand that encompasses both casual/lifestyle shoe aesthetics along with sport/basketball aesthetics...a hybrid.  I chose to take this route because I personally love to wear footwear that have a classy look if I want to dress up, but seeing that I'm an ex-basketball player, I love wearing basketball shoes when dressing down.  Then one day I thought, "Why can't I wear both simultaneously?"  That day, I decided to make it a reality be introducing this line of shoes.



WHY BACK THIS CAMPAIGN?

Here is what you will help contribute to:

  • Help cover the cost of production/delivery the men's NO.2 (US SIZE 8-13)
  • Help cover the cost of production/delivery of the unisex NO.3 (US WMS 5-11 and US MNS 8-13) 
  • Help cover the cost of production/delivery of the women's ASHLEY (US SIZE 5-11)
  • Help cover the cost of opening the outsole and insole molds for the performance NO.2...the Elite, which is scheduled to launch late 2014.
  • All orders placed on the NO.2 will be delivered regardless if goal is reached due to the regulations of the factory I work with
  • Help cover the cost of the sampling/production/delivery of the Q.DESIGNS Accessory and Apparel Collection

WHAT'S THE STORY BEHIND THE COLORWAY AND NAMES?

When creating the Q.DESIGNS line, I wanted the initial shoe to be named "NO.2" because as an artist, creations usually originate with you sketching with the NO.2 pencil...that's the foundation.  We later graduate to pen, marker, pastels, etc.  So the staple colorway of the Q.DESIGNS footwear line will always be Tuscan: brown, black, and pink.  Brown represents the wood of the pencil, black for the lead, and pink for the eraser tip.  As for the women's line, the initial style begins with Ashley because of my fiancé's middle name.  The next style will follow the alphabetical order with B.

WHAT ARE THE GOALS?

  • $12,000 will provide enough funds to get the Tuscan and Gamma NO.2 casually athletic sneakers manufactured and shipped
  • $24,000 will provide enough funds to get the Tuscan and Gamma NO.2 and unisex NO.3 casually athletic sneakers manufactured and shipped
  • $32,000 will provide enough funds to get the Tuscan and Gamma NO.2, the unisex NO.3, and the Ashley (women's sneaker wedge) manufactured and shipped

HELP SPREAD THE BIGGER WORD

Please help spread the word of Q.DESIGNS Footwear even if you can't give a financial contribution.  The bigger meaning of Q.DESIGNS is showing people across the globe that ALL dreams, goals, ideas, and phenomenons can become a reality with dedication and ambition towards your craft.  So once again, if you can't support financially, please consider supporting mentally and verbally by spreading this page via all social media platforms and through family and friends!

You are much appreciated!


QUINTIN WILLIAMS | Founder/Designer of Q.DESIGNS

story:
My Story

Hi there! My name is Semhal Nasreddin, and I'm a graphic designer, illustrator and animal lover living in Ethiopia.  I've designed a line of 16 t-shirts that are colorful and that celebrate animals and their beauty.

I have high hopes of getting these printed soon, but I really need your help.

I need to raise $7,880 to cover the costs of printing the 16 designs, having tags removed and printed, folding, poly bagging, hang tagging, hem tagging, embroidery work, creating and running a website, as well as shipping and fulfillment.

So, I'm turning to my strongest supporters to ask for contributions.  In exchange I'm offering the following 16 t-shirts in any size:

Your contributions will help me create my fashion line and help make my dreams come true. Thank you!! :-D

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute but please Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus and social media outlets. And please help spread the word to your family and friends! :-)


FAQ

story_txt: My StoryHi there! My name is Semhal Nasreddin, and I'm a graphic designer, illustrator and animal lover living in Ethiopia.  I've designed a line of 16 t-shirts that are colorful and that celebrate animals and their beauty.I have high hopes of getting these printed soon, but I really need your help.I need to raise $7,880 to cover the costs of printing the 16 designs, having tags removed and printed, folding, poly bagging, hang tagging, hem tagging, embroidery work, creating and running a website, as well as shipping and fulfillment.So, I'm turning to my strongest supporters to ask for contributions.  In exchange I'm offering the following 16 t-shirts in any size:Your contributions will help me create my fashion line and help make my dreams come true. Thank you!! :-DOther Ways You Can HelpYou may not be able to contribute but please Share this on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus and social media outlets. And please help spread the word to your family and friends! :-)FAQ1) How do I choose my t-shirts and sizes?- Once the campaign is over you will be contacted for size info and t-shirt choice. TEESHEM TAG LABELDetailed Breakdown:For those interested, here's a detailed breakdown. Each t-shirt has a name and the cost associated with it is shown:ALWAYS LOOK UPAA2001 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total = $280.00BE BOLDAA2001 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total = $280.00BE YOURSELFAA2001 / 21026 colors  = $10.50 x 24 = $252.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 6 = $60.00Total = $312.00COLLABORATEAA2001 / 21027 colors  = $10.75 x 24 = $258.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 7 = $70.00Total = $328.00DREAM BIGAA2001 / 21023 colors  = $9.75 x 24 = $234.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 3 = $30.00Total = $264.00EXPRESS YOURSELFAA2001 / 21023 colors  = $9.75 x 24 = $234.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 3 = $30.00Total = $264.00FOLLOW YOUR HEARTAA2001 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total = $280.00HARMONIZEAA2001 / 21022 colors  = $9.50 x 24 = $228.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 2 = $20.00Total = $248.00HAVE FAITHAA2001 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = 10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total = $280.00HAVE FUNAA2001 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total = $280.00KEEP LOOKING AHEAD AA2001 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total = $280.00LIVE LOUDAA2001 / 21023 colors  = $9.75 x 24 = $234.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 3 = $30.00Total = $264.00NEVER GIVE UPAA2001 / 21025 colors  = $10.25 x 24 = $246.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 5 = $50.00Total = $296.00REACH FOR THE STARSAA2102 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total =  $280.00STAND OUTAA2102 / 21024 colors  = $10.00 x 24 = $240.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 4 = $40.00Total = $280.00STAND TALLAA2102 / 21023 colors = $9.75 x 24 = $234.00Screen setup = $10.00 x 3 = $30.00Total = $264.00Tag printing/Removal = $1.00 x 384 = $384.00Tag Screen Setup = $10.00Folding & Poly Bagging = $.50 x 384 = $192.00Hang Tagging = $.50 x 384 = $192.00Hem Tagging = $.50 x 384 = $192.00TOTAL = $5,450.00$430.00 - 1000 Woven Labels for hem tagging$500.00 - Website creation and maintenance$1,500.00 - Shipping and Fulfillment - so I can get all these goodies to you quick! ;-)GRAND TOTAL - $7,880

story:
Fang & Hoof is about getting out there and chasing down what matters to you. Whether it's tangible like Sasquatch, or something more magical like love, friendship or a career move, Fang & Hoof's high-quality stylish goods will help you capture whatever you're hunting—or at least make you look damn good doing it. 

 

Story. The Companion Bag story is simple just like the bag. We wanted to create a jack of all trades bag. A bag big enough and rugged enough to withstand the most adventurous weekend in the woods, yet stylish and professional enough to bring to the office and impress your coworkers on Monday. Sure, there are tons of bags out there that could possibly do that, but they require a kidney to pay for them. The Companion bag is the perfect combination of value and quality, the best part is you can buy one and keep all your  internal accoutrements.

 

 

Color. The Companion Bag comes in two zipper colors. Choose the classic black zipper Companion Bag or for those who want a pop of color, choose the limited edition neon green zipper Companion Bag.  Both are equally awesome, but it will change the way we will think about you when you place your order. 

 

 

 

 

Waxed Canvas. Something extraordinary happens when you apply world famous Martexin Original Wax to 18 oz 100% cotton twill canvas, it creates a water repellent super-material that's strong enough to last a lifetime. This stuff is not just insanely durable, it's also very low maintenance. Seriously, if you want to clean it, just hose it off in your backyard or toss it in a creek.

 

 

Leather. After trying several different types of leather, we finally found Dakota Leather to be the perfect leather for this bag. Known for its durability, this 100% genuine leather is the same stuff used in German luxury cars, making it the right amount of style, functionality, and durability. The handles, side pockets, and bottom are all made with Dakota Leather.

 

 

Slots and Pockets. Inside The Companion Bag, you'll find this handy-dandy laptop slot to batten down your 13"-17" computer. Outside The Companion Bag, you'll find a secure zipper pocket on one side and two easy access pockets on the other.

 

 

 

 

Size. The Companion Bag is big enough to hold all you need for a weekend away or a long day at the office. But because of its malleable waxed canvas structure, it can fit into spaces other leather bags its size can't— like in the backseat of a Mazda Miata Uber.  Measurements: 20" Length X 11" Height X 8" Depth. Approx. 2.5 lbs.

 

 

 Offset Shoulder Strap. This might not seem like a big deal, but when you're creating the perfect bag/companion you want to make sure it's comfortable. The offset shoulder strap allows the waxed canvas to better form to your body, making it feel like a natural extension of you. The shoulder strap itself is made of military grade nylon. Update: since the original prototype of the shoulder strap we have changed the design. The leather shoulder pad is no longer available. Instead, we made the strap adjustable and added some other upgrades to The Companion Bag. The shoulder strap itself is slightly different than the photo below. It still has the Clash hook but does not have the leather ends and is adjustable now. 

 

 

 

 

The C.L.A.S.H Hook. [Conventional Latch Attachment Snap Hook] Inside The Companion Bag is a 1” military grade solid steel hook perfect for securing all your dangly bits, like keys or dehydrated cannibal ears. The quick-on feature with spring loaded retention gate makes getting your keys on and off a breeze.

 

 

Made in the USA. Perhaps best of all, The Fang & Hoof Companion Bag is hand stitched and made right here in the good old US of A.

RISKS.

This isn't our first rodeo, so we expect everything to run smoothly. We were able to overcome multiple obstacles in my first few projects, which allowed us to grow our network in sourcing materials and manufacturing. With these essential contacts, and skills to deliver a quality product, we are confident we will be delivering everything we've promised and more.

Of course, unforeseen obstacles could come up, but we are not doing anything new for us as far as manufacturing goes. Just a new product with exceptional quality.

About Us.

Fang & Hoof is a line designed by Hardel & Co., an organically grown and successfully crowdfunded company. The team consists of Benjamin Roedel and Patrick Koelling. Ben will be your project manager and Pat is your creative genius.

 

Patrick Koelling: 
The companion bag started as a thought when I moved to New York City five years ago and had to sell my car, because there is nowhere to park in NYC for less than $500 a month. Anyways, without a car to keep my stuff in like my sunglasses, nail clippers, magical beans, etc, I had to start carrying around a bag. Pretty soon I realized that I needed a few bags, one for when it rained, one for when I was doing business, one for when I just wanted to go to Central Park and throw the frisbee around.

With so many different needs for a bag, I started searching for the perfect bag that was versatile enough to fit my lifestyle. After searching everywhere in manhattan from Orchard Street on the Lower East Side to even the tourist traps in Midtown, I couldn’t find the bag that could do it all, soooo I teamed up with my pal Ben and we created our own bag. I am a writer by profession and I'm now living in Seattle.

Benjamin Roedel: 
I finished my degree in Business Management and have a passion for the world of entrepreneurship. Once I found kickstarter and saw people successfully funding their startup ideas, I instantly knew I had to be apart of the this community. So here I am hoping to have our 3rd project funded!

As the project manager I have chosen the partners that will best fit our needs to supply and manufacture the Fang & Hoof Companion bag. I am choosing to work with a sewing company that has 20 years experience crafting quality goods with leather and canvas. They have made product for well known American made apparel / dry goods companies.

Once funding takes place, I will be in charge of making sure each step is completed. I personally will be ensuring the highest possible quality bag will be delivered to you, our backer, in a timely manner.

story:
CHECK US OUT AT THE AUSTIN AMERICAN STATESMAN:  http://www.statesman.com/news/business/austin-dads-develop-lightweight-backpack-like-chil/nWd8S/

 

VISIT OUR MEDIA GALLERY FOR ADDITIONAL FOOTAGE AND PRODUCT IMAGES.  

 

A little about the Creator's of the FreeLoader. 

The Creators of the Freeloader are passionate fathers who love to take their children on adventures of the world.  

....a seat built for a freeloader

 

Erick Jansen:

Erick has been in the Bike and Outdoor industry (bike/snow) for the last 26 years, both in retail and in product management.  Half of a dozen of those years were spent at Specialized Bicycles Components, and prior to that, 3 years at TREK Bicycle in Madison, Wisconsin.  He has been an independent Sales Rep for the last 4 years representing some of the larger bike and snow brands.  Somewhere in between, he has been able to squeeze in 12 Years as a firefighter.   When he’s not out spinning on his bike, or paddling out to catch a wave, Erick loves to swim, run, cook, work with wood, and ultimately anything that involves creativity and using his hands.  Finally, as Erick will attest, none of those accomplishments can measure up to his greatest passion of all, being a father to his 8 year old daughter, his inspiration for The Freeloader

Nathan Jones:

Nathan Jones has been a firefighter for the last seven years. He spent most of a decade looking for a wife in California, while completing college, working in online event ticket sales and being a partner in a restaurant in Seattle, WA. Subsequently, Nathan returned to Austin, TX where his entrepreneurial spirit continued. He opened and operated a coffee shop, a real estate company in Central Texas and a bottled water company in California. He also spent time trapped in a cubicle at Dell computers as his soul was quietly leaking from every orifice.  He enjoys surfing (a hobby that was considerably easier to engage in while living in Santa Cruz, CA), rock climbing and playing pick-up soccer on any afternoon of any day where life, work and fatherhood don’t take a front seat. 

ready for whatever comes your way.....

 

 Inspiration

The idea for the Freeloader came to Erick when walking the streets of Paris with his daughter when she was 4 years old.  She was amazingly capable of using her own two feet but there was a definite wall that would be hit and the day would be over.  Thus their Paris nights were restricted to just Paris days.  However, it wasn't until a hike on the Ocean Trail in the Redwood forests of Muir Woods that he came up with a solution to his problem.  What if there was a lightweight, portable pack that could be carried for one of those “in an emergency, just break glass” moments. Something that would not get in the way, but in the event it was needed, a fold down seat could be provided and the adventure could be extended. 

in the beginning..... 

 

 Solving Our Problems

        In this passionate pursuit we frequently came up against the reality that current child carriers are grossly insufficient.  They are incapable of carrying an adequate amount of weight as well as being exceptionally bulky. With our extended, combined history in outdoor gear sales and safety management, we set out to create a new child carrier that would far exceed the carrying capacity of the current market, while creating a smaller, much more portable, more compact pack.  It was clear that in the mountain bike, rock climbing and surfing industry new technologies were being created that produced stronger materials at lighter weights. 

         First it was necessary that we conquer the safety factor.  We looked at three different types of harnesses. We began, of course, by investigating the harnesses that current child carriers utilize (the padded cage), next we looked into current parachute technology figuring that there was, literally, no better harness system than this,  (except for maybe) and finally the current Formula One car harnesses.   Having these three designs to work from, we came up with a simple, yet extremely safe, five-point harness.

          Second, we set out to identify materials that were lightweight and extremely strong.  After spending nine months testing different metals, alloys, plastics and combinations of components, we finally settled on a system that weighed less than three pounds, yet had a failure rate of no less than one hundred pounds.  As a rule, we wanted the folding seat to be able to withstand weight that exceeded what a normal human being could carry (running backs not withstanding).

...."who says bigger is better!"

       

 

         Third, we needed these components to be small, portable and carry-on compatible (arguably the fourth requirement was that this thing look super fly, hip, sleek, something that Hollywood types and professional athletes would wear regardless of whether they even had kids it looked so good, BUT our American gentleman idealism and culture would never allow us to admit to this being a factor). This proved to be the most difficult because we were aware of the fact we had a product that exceeded anything that was currently on the market.  But it needed to fit the high standards we initially set out to achieve.  

         After four generations of prototypes, completely rebuilding bags, being sewn and scrapped and sewn again, multiple frames and hinges manufactured, injection molded components made, endless reams of fabric, spools of string, webs of nylon, we excluded everything that was not explicitly beneficial and The Freeloader was born. 

 And finally, after hundreds of hours, the Freeloader was Born!

Passion in Principle

We subscribe to the theory set forth by Rudolph Steiner that children need to develop their bodies in order to develop their mind.  He breaks down the development of children into three phases.  The first phase culminates around the age of six or seven or when the adult teeth come in. “The … approach to early childhood education is largely experiential, imitative and sensory-based… Outdoor play… providing children with experiences of nature, weather and the seasons of the year”*. The Freeloader is another tool in the toolbox to achieve this sensory based experience for our children.  It allows for life to be lived out there, where the rubber meets the road, where the birds talk and the wind sings. 

We haven’t created a new product for parents to carry their children around everywhere.  On the contrary, it is important to the child’s development that they push their bodies and allow their muscles to grow.  The Freeloader has been created so that 1/4 mile into the walk down the sandy beach toward the lighthouse you don’t have to turn around.  Rather, you just have to drop the seat and give your child a break.  Then, simply let them down and continue on your journey.  No longer do we have to turn back.  The destination is now achievable.  Discover the lighthouse.   But even more importantly, let your child have the satisfaction of reaching a goal and experiencing life.   

who says "three's a crowd?!"

 Why the $30K 

After a year of navigating regulations, securing provisional patents, R&D, agreeing on multiple designs, breaking numerous sewing machines, dealing with welders and CAD engineers, rapid prototyping, and kids as test dummies  we need $30,000 to get us to the next phase of development.   

By reaching the $30,000 goal we will be able to pay for all of the tooling, machining and manufacturing costs for every separate component.  This in turn will allow us to create the pack at the best price with the best (optimal, premium?) performance. If we are unable to reach our entire funding goal, the process will be slowed exceptionally.  The tooling and machining costs alone would have to be taken on individually over the course of a few years, driving up the estimated retail price and delaying the release of The Freeloader. 

Production Plan

Once the $30K is raised, it will take 90-120 days for the packs to be manufactured.  During this time we will have the fold down seats manufactured locally in Central Texas.  Once all of the components have been assembled the pack will undergo a final round of inspection and then shipped to your door!  

Risks and Challenges

One of our highest priorities we had before bringing the Freeloader to the Indiegogo community was to ensure, to the best of our ability, every aspect of the production was accounted for. This would allow us to give an accurate expectation as to when the Freeloader would be delivered. We took the number of days that our vendors promised us and added 20%, allowing us a cushion, should we encounter unplanned production delays.  But like all things under the sun, nothing is permanent nor guaranteed.  We feel we have accounted for all variables but should obstacles arise we will be open and transparent, keeping our backers abreast of all pertinent information. 

PERKS for our BACKERS, the gift of giving to those that give to us

 Now our perks are not, not cool. 

First ($12 Perk)

There are the aviators.  Every glove box in the country should have a pair as back up.  Not as a backup for your go-to pair of sunglasses, but as a backup for life's little surprises, like when you unexpectedly cry or want to stare off into the sunset when Desperado comes on the radio.

 

Second ($35 Perk)

We here at FreeLoader HQ we dig on the soft Ts.  So we don't expect you to be any different.  This isn't going to be a 5mm thick 100% cotton, starched and scratchy and usable as a fire suppressant.  This shirt is going to fit just righteous, not pulling on your biceps or nothing.  Just form fitting, the way we know, that you know, that we know you like em.   And we'll drop some of the Aviators in too, just in case your glove box is a little light. WE WILL VERIFY SIZE AND COLOR OPTIONS PRIOR TO DELIVERY. 

            

Third ($50 Perk)

There is the sweet, noble, handmade, one of a kind wooden sword.  It is custom made, by an unpaid Freeloader employee who just happens to be half Dutch with quite a bit of institutional knowledge of wood working. 

 

Fourth ($99 Perk)

In the same vein as the wieldy sword, a Step Stool for anyone who ever wanted to get a leg up in life, or just reach higher ground.  Two equally stylish designs to choose from.  The 60's Perfectly Pink VW Bug and the 50's Woody Wagon. I for one like to look taller in the mirror. 

Fifth ($159 Perk)

The Freeloader.  Finally, finally, finally, the product, the evasive cure to so many unknown woes. Multiple Freeloader options available in our Perks section.

 

Lastly ($1500)

We are offering a chauffeur for the entire music portion of SXSW.  Austin, TX hosts one of the most internationally renowned music festivals in the world.  With over 2,000 accomplished bands trickling in from every corner of the globe, it's a veritable list of who’s who in the music industry and thousands (of hipsters, of music fans, etc) descending upon the Live Music Capital of the World.  For that matter bring your kid, we are throwing in a  Freeloader and the driver will be a trained father with a car seat correctly installed (no less).   

 Make life a little bit sweeter....

 

The 21st Century Child Carrier

 What you are doing by helping….

After a year, we have finally designed, tested, retested (ad nauseam), and at last arrived at our destination.  A child carrier that is extremely safe, looks awesome (we did design the seat after mid to late 60's Schwinn Orange Crate bikes after all), feels and wears comfortably, whether loaded with a Freeloader or not. It's lightweight and can withstand loads vastly exceeding those that are even possible to carry. 

By backing this campaign now you have the option of getting one of the first Freeloaders or just helping to ensure it is available down the road when you choose to reproduce and have a little freeloader of your very own.  

You are also helping to bring into existence a novel new product.  One that will allow parents to go farther, kids to experience more and the family nucleus to simultaneously broaden their horizons.  This isn’t your parent’s child carrier. 

Please, please, get the word out there to any of your friends and family you think might be able to benefit from the Freeloader, or if you just think we're cute, sweet and funny.  It helps more than you know to even "like" us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter.  Let alone, to blast an email out about what we think to be an amazing, new child carrier.  All contributions, be it time or money are greatly appreciated.  We couldn't make this adventure happen without the willingness of our backers and we will be forever grateful to all of y'all. 

Let others know to share the campaign to others!

 FAQs:

  • We will email you as to which color of Freeloader you would prefer!!!
  • The only storage built in at this point is on the waist belts which will easily hold, keys, a wallet, cell phone and the like. We initially wanted to address the needs of being lightweight, portable and minimalist. The Freeloader is comparable in size to current hydration packs on the market.  We do have an "Adventure" edition that is slated for release early next year which will include a hydration system and additional small storage. The price on this version is yet to be determined.

 

CHECK OUT THE MUSICIAN BEHIND OUR MUSIC!!!! BRIAN M.F. HUDSON

http://www.brianhudsonmusic.com

 

The version of this song, Working for a Woman, can be found at:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FhcgvQbthD8

 

 

 

 

*http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudolph_Steiner 2/1/13

ready for whatever comes your way.....
 
 Inspiration
The idea for the Freeloader came to Erick when walking the streets of Paris with his daughter when she was 4 years old.  She was amazingly capable of using her own two feet but there was a definite wall that would be hit and the day would be over.  Thus their Paris nights were restricted to just Paris days.  However, it wasn't until a hike on the Ocean Trail in the Redwood forests of Muir Woods that he came up with a solution to his problem.  What if there was a lightweight, portable pack that could be carried for one of those “in an emergency, just break glass” moments. Something that would not get in the way, but in the event it was needed, a fold down seat could be provided and the adventure could be extended. 
in the beginning..... 

 
 Solving Our Problems
        In this passionate pursuit we frequently came up against the reality that current child carriers are grossly insufficient.  They are incapable of carrying an adequate amount of weight as well as being exceptionally bulky. With our extended, combined history in outdoor gear sales and safety management, we set out to create a new child carrier that would far exceed the carrying capacity of the current market, while creating a smaller, much more portable, more compact pack.  It was clear that in the mountain bike, rock climbing and surfing industry new technologies were being created that produced stronger materials at lighter weights. 
         First it was necessary that we conquer the safety factor.  We looked at three different types of harnesses. We began, of course, by investigating the harnesses that current child carriers utilize (the padded cage), next we looked into current parachute technology figuring that there was, literally, no better harness system than this,  (except for maybe) and finally the current Formula One car harnesses.   Having these three designs to work from, we came up with a simple, yet extremely safe, five-point harness.
          Second, we set out to identify materials that were lightweight and extremely strong.  After spending nine months testing different metals, alloys, plastics and combinations of components, we finally settled on a system that weighed less than three pounds, yet had a failure rate of no less than one hundred pounds.  As a rule, we wanted the folding seat to be able to withstand weight that exceeded what a normal human being could carry (running backs not withstanding).
...."who says bigger is better!"
       
 
         Third, we needed these components to be small, portable and carry-on compatible (arguably the fourth requirement was that this thing look super fly, hip, sleek, something that Hollywood types and professional athletes would wear regardless of whether they even had kids it looked so good, BUT our American gentleman idealism and culture would never allow us to admit to this being a factor). This proved to be the most difficult because we were aware of the fact we had a product that exceeded anything that was currently on the market.  But it needed to fit the high standards we initially set out to achieve.  
         After four generations of prototypes, completely rebuilding bags, being sewn and scrapped and sewn again, multiple frames and hinges manufactured, injection molded components made, endless reams of fabric, spools of string, webs of nylon, we excluded everything that was not explicitly beneficial and The Freeloader was born. 
 And finally, after hundreds of hours, the Freeloader was Born!

Passion in Principle
We subscribe to the theory set forth by Rudolph Steiner that children need to develop their bodies in order to develop their mind.  He breaks down the development of children into three phases.  The first phase culminates around the age of six or seven or when the adult teeth come in. “The … approach to early childhood education is largely experiential, imitative and sensory-based… Outdoor play… providing children with experiences of nature, weather and the seasons of the year”*. The Freeloader is another tool in the toolbox to achieve this sensory based experience for our children.  It allows for life to be lived out there, where the rubber meets the road, where the birds talk and the wind sings. 
We haven’t created a new product for parents to carry their children around everywhere.  On the contrary, it is important to the child’s development that they push their bodies and allow their muscles to grow.  The Freeloader has been created so that 1/4 mile into the walk down the sandy beach toward the lighthouse you don’t have to turn around.  Rather, you just have to drop the seat and give your child a break.  Then, simply let them down and continue on your journey.  No longer do we have to turn back.  The destination is now achievable.  Discover the lighthouse.   But even more importantly, let your child have the satisfaction of reaching a goal and experiencing life.   
who says "three's a crowd?!"

 Why the $30K 
After a year of navigating regulations, securing provisional patents, R&D, agreeing on multiple designs, breaking numerous sewing machines, dealing with welders and CAD engineers, rapid prototyping, and kids as test dummies  we need $30,000 to get us to the next phase of development.   
By reaching the $30,000 goal we will be able to pay for all of the tooling, machining and manufacturing costs for every separate component.  This in turn will allow us to create the pack at the best price with the best (optimal, premium?) performance. If we are unable to reach our entire funding goal, the process will be slowed exceptionally.  The tooling and machining costs alone would have to be taken on individually over the course of a few years, driving up the estimated retail price and delaying the release of The Freeloader. 
Production Plan
Once the $30K is raised, it will take 90-120 days for the packs to be manufactured.  During this time we will have the fold down seats manufactured locally in Central Texas.  Once all of the components have been assembled the pack will undergo a final round of inspection and then shipped to your door!  
Risks and Challenges
One of our highest priorities we had before bringing the Freeloader to the Indiegogo community was to ensure, to the best of our ability, every aspect of the production was accounted for. This would allow us to give an accurate expectation as to when the Freeloader would be delivered. We took the number of days that our vendors promised us and added 20%, allowing us a cushion, should we encounter unplanned production delays.  But like all things under the sun, nothing is permanent nor guaranteed.  We feel we have accounted for all variables but should obstacles arise we will be open and transparent, keeping our backers abreast of all pertinent information. 
PERKS for our BACKERS, the gift of giving to those that give to us

 Now our perks are not, not cool. 
First ($12 Perk)
There are the aviators.  Every glove box in the country should have a pair as back up.  Not as a backup for your go-to pair of sunglasses, but as a backup for life's little surprises, like when you unexpectedly cry or want to stare off into the sunset when Desperado comes on the radio.
 
Second ($35 Perk) 
We here at FreeLoader HQ we dig on the soft Ts.  So we don't expect you to be any different.  This isn't going to be a 5mm thick 100% cotton, starched and scratchy and usable as a fire suppressant.  This shirt is going to fit just righteous, not pulling on your biceps or nothing.  Just form fitting, the way we know, that you know, that we know you like em.   And we'll drop some of the Aviators in too, just in case your glove box is a little light. WE WILL VERIFY SIZE AND COLOR OPTIONS PRIOR TO DELIVERY. 
            
Third ($50 Perk)
There is the sweet, noble, handmade, one of a kind wooden sword.  It is custom made, by an unpaid Freeloader employee who just happens to be half Dutch with quite a bit of institutional knowledge of wood working. 
 

Fourth ($99 Perk)
In the same vein as the wieldy sword, a Step Stool for anyone who ever wanted to get a leg up in life, or just reach higher ground.  Two equally stylish designs to choose from.  The 60's Perfectly Pink VW Bug and the 50's Woody Wagon. I for one like to look taller in the mirror. 

Fifth ($159 Perk)
The Freeloader.  Finally, finally, finally, the product, the evasive cure to so many unknown woes. Multiple Freeloader options available in our Perks section.
 

Lastly ($1500)
We are offering a chauffeur for the entire music portion of SXSW.  Austin, TX hosts one of the most internationally renowned music festivals in the world.  With over 2,000 accomplished bands trickling in from every corner of the globe, it's a veritable list of who’s who in the music industry and thousands (of hipsters, of music fans, etc) descending upon the Live Music Capital of the World.  For that matter bring your kid, we are throwing in a  Freeloader and the driver will be a trained father with a car seat correctly installed (no less).   

 Make life a little bit sweeter....
 
The 21st Century Child Carrier
 What you are doing by helping….
After a year, we have finally designed, tested, retested (ad nauseam), and at last arrived at our destination.  A child carrier that is extremely safe, looks awesome (we did design the seat after mid to late 60's Schwinn Orange Crate bikes after all), feels and wears comfortably, whether loaded with a Freeloader or not. It's lightweight and can withstand loads vastly exceeding those that are even possible to carry. 
By backing this campaign now you have the option of getting one of the first Freeloaders or just helping to ensure it is available down the road when you choose to reproduce and have a little freeloader of your very own.  
You are also helping to bring into existence a novel new product.  One that will allow parents to go farther, kids to experience more and the family nucleus to simultaneously broaden their horizons.  This isn’t your parent’s child carrier. 
Please, please, get the word out there to any of your friends and family you think might be able to benefit from the Freeloader, or if you just think we're cute, sweet and funny.  It helps more than you know to even "like" us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter.  Let alone, to blast an email out about what we think to be an amazing, new child carrier.  All contributions, be it time or money are greatly appreciated.  We couldn't make this adventure happen without the willingness of our backers and we will be forever grateful to all of y'all. 
Let others know to share the campaign to others!
 FAQs:

We will email you as to which color of Freeloader you would prefer!!!
The only storage built in at this point is on the waist belts which will easily hold, keys, a wallet, cell phone and the like. We initially wanted to address the needs of being lightweight, portable and minimalist. The Freeloader is comparable in size to current hydration packs on the market.  We do have an "Adventure" edition that is slated for release early next year which will include a hydration system and additional small storage. The price on this version is yet to be determined.
 
CHECK OUT THE MUSICIAN BEHIND OUR MUSIC!!!! BRIAN M.F. HUDSON
http://www.brianhudsonmusic.com
 
The version of this song, Working for a Woman, can be found at:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FhcgvQbthD8
 
 
 
 
*http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rudolph_Steiner 2/1/13

story:
Sign up for our mailing list HERE to stay connected and follow our progress.

You can also find us at:

Twitter: @PYSIS
Facebook: PYSISinc
Pinterest: PYSIS

 

 

Message from our Founder

Hi!  I'm Cassandra Droogan - a New York City girl who had a New York City problem.  I like to wear the shoes I want to wear - and hate to compromise for the weather. 

I worked in corporate banking for years and always dreamed of being an entrepreneur.  So, when the recession hit and I lost my job, I realized it was go time! 

And I haven't looked back!

Over the past five years I've learned what a major effort and crazy roller coaster ride it is to design and develop a new product - patent it, brand it and secure a qualified, responsible factory to produce it.

And, finally... I'm SO excited to bring you PYSIS! 

I hope you'll back this campaign to get a pair for yourself - or your favorite lady. :)  And, just as important: to help spread the word!!

It takes an enthusiastic village to get the word out about a new product and I'm so appreciative of the opportunity to share PYSIS and my story with you! 

THANK YOU for taking the time to learn about PYSIS and be part of my journey!

Yours in Perfect Pumps, 

Cassandra Droogan
Founder & President, PYSIS Inc.  

 

PYSIS Overboots

Brand Overview 

Whether you're headed to the office, an important lunch meeting, or a special night out...

You deserve to look and feel your best and we want you to arrive in style!  Whatever the weather. 

Have you ever tried to negotiate that huge puddle or snow mound in a pair of dress shoes?  Or needed to dress to the nines - while the weather dictates footwear in... the threes!?  Or worn heavy, bulky rain boots, while carrying shoes separately??

Well, no more!  We've created a solution.

PYSIS Overboots are galoshes (or rain boots worn OVER shoes) that can be worn over many different styles of shoes and boots to protect them from rain, slush, salt and snow.  And each pair is sold with a convenient carry bag. 

Our name is pronounced like the water sign: Pisces. It stands for "Protect Your Shoes In Style" and we stand for keeping you gorgeous and your shoes impeccable.

We invite you to be part of our story and help grow this exciting new brand.  With your help, PYSIS can truly become the next BIG thing!  Remember the UGGs craze??  Well, overboots have arrived!

Please back this campaign to be among the very first to own a pair of PYSIS, and spread the word so every woman (and eventually man!) who owns shoes can own proper protection. :)

Go ahead... Get Sloshed!  And always, Protect Your Shoes In Style.

 

Overboot Overview

 

  • Elastic Closure for adjustable fit.
  • Soft Patent *Polyurethane (PU) Upper for convenient collapsibility.
  • Bootie Construction Liner for added protection. Nylon lining.
  • Seams Sealed with PU tape.
  • Molded Rubber Cup Sole for strong seal with Upper.

 

  • Reinforced Insole for added strength.
  • Treaded Rubber Sole for traction.

 

Sizing Guidance

  • Small PYSIS protect fabulous shoes in sizes US 5 (Euro 35) - US 7 (Euro 37.5)*
  • Medium PYSIS protect fabulous shoes in sizes US 7.5 (Euro 38) - US 9 (Euro 39.5)*
  • Large PYSIS protect fabulous shoes in sizes US 9.5 (Euro 40) –US 11 (Euro 41.5)*

*Sizing Guidance is based on wearing PYSIS to protect your high heeled shoes. If you wear size 7/37.5 or 9/39.5 shoes and you wear primarily kitten heels or wide shoes, you might consider going up a size for your overboots. 
For added security, elastic can be looped around the button multiple
times. 

 

Early Testimonials

New Yorkers waited patiently for their PYSIS...

  • "It was snowing so I had to change my whole outfit for New Year’s Eve and I couldn’t wear the Manolos that I was dying to wear! When will the PYSIS be available??"
    – C.M.
  • "I really need PYSIS right now!!!!!!! I have to go to a dressy lunch at Balthazar and don’t want to destroy my shoes. I have rain boots at work, but now I am going to have to get a shopping bag big enough to put the rain boots in when I get to Balthazar so I can wear nice shoes at the restaurant."
    - P.M.
  • "My wife, daughter, and our baby sitter are all good prospects for your overshoes. They all have these big, heavy 5lb rubber rain boots. They are always leaving them at the wrong place. And they only need them for 15 to 30 minutes at a time. Your idea is so much smarter."
    – K.O.
  • "We went to a concert in New Jersey and had to walk in the rain from the car to the stadium. We all agreed we wished we’d had overboots!"
    – L.G.

 

Perks for Contributions

We're so excited to bring you PYSIS and for you to contribute to bringing overboots to the masses!  Your participation will be so meaningful to our success in our inaugural Fall season. 

Perks
Here is what your contributions will get you...

  • $130 - PYSIS Overboots! ONLY the first 50 to sign up can take advantage of getting a pair of PYSIS for this special "Early Bird" offer!
  • $180 - PYSIS Overboots! And you'll get them for below the expected retail price when they're available in stores!
  • For $250 you'll get PYSIS Overboots + the "Made just for Indiegogo" Umbrella and T-shirt shown below!
  • For $450 you'll get THREE pairs of PYSIS Overboots (one in each size: S, M, L) and you can host a Trunk Show to introduce your friends or colleagues to PYSIS!

And we have some other exciting perks to offer...

  • $50 - Dare to Dream!  Chat with our founder about how you can bring YOUR big idea to life! 
  • $1,000 - Sell PYSIS in your retail store! You'll get 10 pairs to sell & we'll work with you to WOW your customers with this exciting new product! 
  • $2,800 - You'll get 30 pairs of PYSIS to sell in your retail store!

Also, we're offering some limited edition goodies for those who wish to support this exciting new brand at lower levels.  See our fun promotional products below.  All products are specially branded and being made just for this campaign!

  • LIMITED EDITION "Love Your Shoes" PYSIS Umbrella

Made just for Indiegogo!

  • LIMITED EDITION "Go ahead... Get Sloshed" PYSIS T-shirt

Made just for Indiegogo!  In women's and men's styles.

Contributions
Money contributed to our $50,000 goal will primarily allow us to get PYSIS to you and LOVE to your shoes - while we work on producing more! 

Contributions over and above $50,000 will allow us to really kick things into gear!  We'll be able to fill more of your orders, first & foremost - and possibly offer a new style!  We'll also be able to kick up our sales and marketing efforts to get PYSIS into retail stores and get the word out in a bigger way. 

And if you can't contribute to any of the Perk levels - please consider helping us spread the word!  Your sharing this campaign will be so meaningful.  And you'll be giving others the gift of gorgeous shoes. :) 

We're on Facebook, Twitter and YouTube too - please like, follow and share! 

 

Early Buzz

The reception from those who have already learned about PYSIS has been amazing! 

  • Fox 5 News DC featured PYSIS in its "Next Great Thing" segment in February

"Stylish & comfortable – providing  even more stability than wearing your heels alone”.

  • Fox CT - "Fashion Essentials for April Showers"

"...has been a hit in the studio this morning!"

  • News 12 Long Island - "Be In Style for April Showers" (PYSIS at 1:43)

“…start this rainy season off on the right foot!”

  • Newsday - "April Showers Shopping"

"Not Your Father's Galoshes"

  • Beauty News NYC - "Look Fabulous Even in the Rain!"

"These fancy shmancy galoshes have been created with style and practicality".

  • Accessories Magazine - "Item of the Day"

"PYSIS can be removed when the sun comes out and returned to their handy carry bag and you return to prancing around in your new designer heels high and dry."

  • Entertainment Vine - "Every Woman In The World Will Want"

"Here is the shoe 411 & what every woman in the world will want!"

  • Can Ya Heel Me? - "The Rainboots That Will Change Your Life"

"It’s just not fair! Favorite outfits have raincoats, why can’t favorite shoes, too? Well ladies, now THEY CAN!!!!"

  • Neha Uberoi - "Rain Boots For Women"


"I tested them yesterday, on my commute in to New York City and fell in love."

  • Shoeography - "Shoe of the Day"

"No longer will you be at the mercy of bad weather." 

  • Ridgely's Radar - Our first blog mention!

"They were very comfortable, light weight and made walking in heels more stable".

 

The Future of PYSIS

We have a dream. To create an exciting new niche in the rainwear industry - a pair of overboots in every closet!

We're contemplating different colors and styles of overboots - a sample of the ladies "bootie" style is already in the works.  ...not to mention PYSIS for Men.  And who knows where we can go from there! 

But, we believe that measured growth - and listening to our valued customers - will be the key to success.  So, your feedback will be considered and appreciated.

And not only do we want to bring overboots to the masses and continue the noble work of saving gorgeous shoes :)... but, we want to create jobs and be a real contributor to the economy.

Already, during the recession, PYSIS has contributed to the job security of so many valued consultants, advisors and professionals who have worked to make PYSIS' launch possible.  From branding, to product development, to patenting, website development and photography - it's been a pleasure to work with so many talented consultants and work to bring PYSIS to life! 

But, the real exciting part is still ahead: When PYSIS can hire designers, developers, a sales staff and more!  We'll know we've made it when we've created a thriving business and can contribute to the economy in a substantial way.

As our founder likes to say: "Dream Big... and take baby steps".  And it all starts with getting the very first production run into your hands. 

Here we go!

 

Contact Us

Thanks for your interest in our campaign!  Please reach out to us with any questions or comments....

 contact@pysis.com
 855-GO-PYSIS
(855-467-9747)
 @PYSIS
 Facebook.com/PYSISinc

But, we believe that measured growth - and listening to our valued customers - will be the key to success.  So, your feedback will be considered and appreciated.
And not only do we want to bring overboots to the masses and continue the noble work of saving gorgeous shoes :)... but, we want to create jobs and be a real contributor to the economy.
Already, during the recession, PYSIS has contributed to the job security of so many valued consultants, advisors and professionals who have worked to make PYSIS' launch possible.  From branding, to product development, to patenting, website development and photography - it's been a pleasure to work with so many talented consultants and work to bring PYSIS to life! 
But, the real exciting part is still ahead: When PYSIS can hire designers, developers, a sales staff and more!  We'll know we've made it when we've created a thriving business and can contribute to the economy in a substantial way.
As our founder likes to say: "Dream Big... and take baby steps".  And it all starts with getting the very first production run into your hands. 
Here we go!
 
Contact Us
Thanks for your interest in our campaign!  Please reach out to us with any questions or comments....
 contact@pysis.com 855-GO-PYSIS(855-467-9747) @PYSIS Facebook.com/PYSISinc

story:
“When the truth is a lie, reality is an illusion.

but you can’t white out the world so easily,

the nothing left is an emptiness so full it can kill you…”

 

 

HVNTER GVTHERER announces the debut of the IRON AGE collection with an experiential fashion/lifestyle show and live performance. In one night only, the darkest of dreams will pierce our illusion of reality.  More nightmare than nirvana, the sensory experience that awaits aims to connect the conscious and the subconscious, the past and the present, the primal and the civilized.

Postdating the BRONZE AGE, the IRON AGE explores systems of power, our relationship with raw materials and the effects of late capitalism. Inspired by a misplaced dream, current events and personal narrative, the designer offers a collection that asks more questions than it can answer.

 

The debut will be held June 30th, at Black Oak Tattoo, Chicago, IL. The evening kicks off at 7pm and will feature models, performers, and a DJ.


 

Conceptual Narrative:

We are in a dystopian civilization inescapably submitted to capitalism. What’s needed is an awakening, one that happens deep inside us, from a primordial place that makes up our very soul. This place is connected to the iron age world, where iron and weaponry are symbols of power used to divide the haves from the have nots.

Historically, we have quantified our progress through the material ages as a way to define our achievements and mastery of the physical world.  “Iron Age” specifically is an era spanning roughly 2000+ years that ushered in industrialization.

But what modernized us may also destroy us and the Iron Age collection is an artistic interpretation of a collective “Epiphany” – experienced as a slap in the face or a poke in the ass. It offers us a chance come to terms with and interpret our current age and impending social, environmental and economic catastrophes.

In Hvnter Gvtherer spirit of responsible production as in previous collections, Iron Age materials are sourced from deadstock fabrics found locally, other pre-worn black leather garments ( as in the 2015 collection SAL ET CORIUM ) and hand polished and hand sewn vintage iron nails.

The Iron Age fashion show will showcase a collection of handmade, conceptual garments in a monochromatic dark, moody palette with pops of contrasting elements that satiate the senses through texture, shape, and sound. The quiet murmur of linen panels brushing against the body, moments of flesh revealed through black silk organza, unusual and asymmetrical cuts are designed to suit a wide variety of body types.
 

Support and Funding:

Hvnter Gvtherer needs your help turning this show into a reality. By supporting Hvnter Gvtherer, your donation goes towards exhibition expenses, DJ expenses, rental equipment, materials, promotions, refreshments, and the production of the work. Your help also assists our models who put in their generous time and extensive effort into this dream. Please share this opportunity with your friends, family, and anyone who may be interested. 

Links:

Visit our website: http://hvntergvtherer.com

On Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Hvntergvtherer/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/hvntergvtherer/

Videos by and collaborations with the designer:https://vimeo.com/hvntergvtherer

Press: http://hvntergvtherer.com/press

Blog:http://hvntergvtherer.com/new-blog/

 

“Hvnter Gvtherer is a Chicago-based jewelry line that features striking metal work and simple yet modern designs that call upon the ideology and imagery of primitive human cultures and trade techniques... We immediately identified with her emphasis on materials, minimalist design style and conceptual campaigns.”  - THE BRVTALIST

 

"Laura's one of a kind handmade pieces skirt the line between wearable everyday jewelry and high art." - Blog Feature, FOXTAIL + MOSS


We want to thank everyone who will be part of the fashion show! :

 

Models:

Lauren Bach

Heather Gabel

Justina Kairytė

Jetti Lewis

Catherine Matthews

Cara L. Molitor

Benji Morino

Enrico Antonio Pili

Noelia Torres

Amanda Trumbull

 

DJ: Chris Hefner

Photography: http://fotobymateo.com/client

 

 

Special thanks to artists and friends:

Chelsea Wolfe for believing in our brand and wearing IRON AGE dress and hair glove accessories onstage for her performance at the Riviera Theater earlier this year

 

Hidden Folk for an extra special collaborative IRON AGE scent debuting June 30

http://hidden-folk.com/

 

Dead Meat Design for the printing of our Bandanna and T-Shirt Rewards

https://deadmeatdesign.bigcartel.com/products

 

Credits: http://hvntergvtherer.com/credits/

 

Check out SAL ET CORIUM, one of the previous collections that gave us the experience and motivation to build and launch IRON AGE   

Risks and Challenges:

The difficulties here are almost always budget, time, and helping hands. Every piece is handmade in a private atelier and by not cutting any corners in the making process, these pieces need an abundance of time and energy. Hard work and devotion are necessary to pull this off. Hvnter Gvtherer has been running since 2012 and has had experience budgeting and working with deadlines. This brand wants to grow above and beyond jewelry to create a lifestyle brand filled with thought-provoking fashion, homewares, and accessories. Please help us launch this fashion/lifestyle show to kick-off this new era of our brand.

Thank you all for your help and support!

story:
Our Story:

For the past few years, the middle schoolers in our program have participated in an event called Maker Immersion Week. This is a time for us to practice entrepreneurship and social skills in the real world by working with professionals and our peers to produce high-quality products and sell them to support our school. Wet Hands Print Shop is one of those projects.  For the next few months, we will be selling top-of-the-line t-shirts that we designed in a way that represents our school and its students. We've worked with teachers from different levels to create designs that symbolize each level. We have different designs for each age, from Primary School all the way up to Middle School. However, all the designs have a few things in common. For one, all of them are printed professionally by a local business. Additionally, the images we selected for each grade are printed inside of a coat of arms to help show school spirit. 

Maker Immersion Week is always a really valuable experience for us. Throughout the week, even over Zoom this year, we practice working as a team and learn about economics. We do exercises to help us understand business and sales principles, plus are educated on life skills that can help us far after our school journey is complete. 

Designs:

Infant, Toddler, Primary:

These designs are focused on the Infant/Toddler/Primary levels in our school. We came up with a bubble wand surrounded by bubbles, a frog holding a paintbrush, and two birds sitting together. The bubble wand is meant to show unity, and togetherness of the levels, as the teachers told us that they both really enjoy bubbles; it is one of the factors that brings them together.  The frog represents education and the fact that it is holding a paintbrush shows how important creativity is in learning which is a foundation of Montessori education. The birds represent some of the core qualities of their communities which are peace and friendship.

 

Lower Elementary:

The three images we made to represent the lower elementary level at our school include a beehive, a butterfly silhouette with plants drawn in the wings, and a scene of a butterfly and a bee flying around two plants. The beehive represents how this level is always very lively. “Our level is often abuzz with activity,” one teacher had said. The next image depicts an ocotillo plant and manzanita plant drawn in the two wings of a silhouetted Mariposa butterfly. These plants and insects are meant to represent the three classes: Ocotillo, Manzanita, and Mariposa. The final image on this T-shirt, a butterfly and a bee flying around two plants, represents collaboration. The butterfly is a Mariposa, one of the plants is an ocotillo plant, and the other is a manzanita plant. The two plants and the two insects in this image are existing in harmony together, which also represents working together, or collaboration.

 

Upper Elementary:

This shirt’s designs all represent the Upper Elementary environment in different ways. The book represents our determination for knowledge or a newfound love for reading that is given in Upper Elementary. The hand shows creativity. Everyone in Upper Elementary is unique and has their own style of completing work and moving ahead. The checkerboard shows the organization of the Upper Elementary. In Upper Elementary, boards with patterns of squares are included in many math works. 

 

Middle School:

The Middle School shirt design was inspired by a few things, from our passion  for learning, to our community goals, to our deep connection with the environment.  The hands in the top left corner are the symbol of our Montessori program. The Saguaro Cactus represents how we treat our environment as well as our persistence to grow upwards no matter what the condition is. The dove symbolizes our school’s commitment to peace and mindfulness, and the beaker in the top right is meant to immortalize the countless hands-on experiences we encounter.

story:
Each series encompass a different element; minimalism, elegant or bold to suit your need for various occasions.         

The ALBIREO (Single Handed Quartz)

Inspires by the appearance of the ancient sundial, this timepiece has a touch of minimalism to the dial gives the watch a modern classic look. The single hand timekeeping system used in pocket watches is easy on the eyes and provides a quick time check at a glance.       

 

HOW TO TELL TIME WITH ALBERIO       

The GIENAH (3 Hands Quartz with Date)       

This elegant timepiece reveals its simplicity. The dial plate is crafted carefully with the photo-etching technique meaning each recessed curve is a distinctive crisp line.       

The DENEB (Automatic Mechanical) 

Deneb. The brightest star in the Cygnus Constellation accurately resembles our most high-end watch. The dual-layered hexagonal mesh dial plates allow you to get a glimpse of the skeleton structure of the 8N24 Miyota movement. The 21 jewels Automatic Self Winding movement not only reveal the details and complication of its structure, but it also gives excellent accuracy as the soul of this luxury watch.         

The Normal Retail Distribution
Typical Crowdfunding Markup
OUR WATCH'S MARKUP

Not only have we eliminated the various middlemen between our product and the customer, but we’ve also gone one step further to reduce the price even more by letting our manufacturer become our strategic partner. This way, we can cut their profit margin as well as reduce the marginal cost of each scattering supplier that we find on our own. The result allows us to present our watches to you at almost factory pricing. We can now offer you a limited edition Italian designed luxury automatic watch for less than USD$220.       

Our strategic partner has been in the watch industry since 1993, and they are currently in production for some of the world’s most renowned luxurious timepieces that retail at above $10,000. Their facilities obtained certification by the ISO9001:2015 and ISO14001:2015 standard for quality and environmental management.       

EACH TIMEPIECE IS HANDCRAFTED  

Each Cygnus watch made from surgical grade 316L stainless steel offers high strength vs. weight ratio. Another characteristic of this material is its exceptional ability to resist oxidation which means it does not corrode easily.

To show our appreciation for the early support, we will be releasing the first 999 of our “Founders’ Edition” timepieces in each of our watch series as our special reward to you.       

 

Our interchangeable watch straps are all carefully handcrafted to ensure that each timepiece fits comfortably on wrists of all sizes, regardless of gender.  Each set of straps will also come with a brushed stainless steel buckle and engraved with our brand “CYGNUS”.  The wristband includes a quick-release spring bar so that it can be swapped to another strap very quickly without any tool.

We thought about using a wooden box with a see-through display window. Heck! We even thought about making it with carbon fiber to show how beautiful a package could look, but you'd know the cost would be passed on to our customer; you.        

We would rather spend the cost of making the best quality watch than to spend it on something you'd set aside to collect dust. Because after all, we know a great watch is made to be worn, and not made to be spun in a watch winder.

There will be a separate box for the extra straps.       

 

         

This traveler case can fit up to 3 watches.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
